questions.question_text: Which of the following is MOST helpful to identify whether information security policies have been followed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
it is detective. It cannot be preventative
The key word in the question is "Identify". Identify = Detect. Therefore the correct answer is C. Detective controls

Selected Answer: D
Preventive - Policy is designed to prevent first. Detection just tells you the policy was violated.

Selected Answer: C
C. Detective controls.

Detective controls are designed to detect and identify deviations from established security policies and procedures. They help organizations monitor and identify potential security incidents or policy violations by actively monitoring and analyzing system logs, conducting security audits, and performing regular security assessments. Detective controls can include activities such as security monitoring, intrusion detection systems, log analysis, and security incident response.

Selected Answer: C
C. Detective controls

The MAIN reason for continuous monitoring of the security program is to:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Benefits are being realized in the sense of business is being protected. Vague wording though.

Selected Answer: D
CISM Exam Prep Guide (2nd ed.) says the following:

"Continuous monitoring is the process of monitoring compliance on an ongoing basis. The prime objective of continuous monitoring is to provide immediate feedback about the performance of servers, networks, and cloud environments. This helps to enhance operational, security, and business performance."

To me, D is the closest answer as it represents the GOAL. Option B would be a metric in function of option D.

Selected Answer: B
B includes D --> B

D. optimize resource allocation. Continuous monitoring helps ensure the uptimal allocation of resources which is crucial in risk management. Answer option B. is too vague. Business concepts are not usually that vague which is why i eliminated that choice. Also, sometimes even when a company is realizing benefits from a program, the company has to continue to monitor in order to uptimize the allocation of resources in order to achieve the best possible scenario given available resources.

Selected Answer: D
Continuous monitoring of the security program is essential for optimizing resource allocation because it provides organizations with real-time insights into the effectiveness of their security controls and the level of risk they face. This information can then be used to prioritize security investments and allocate resources more effectively.
B. Confirm benefits are being realized: Confirming that benefits are being realized is important for justifying the investment in security, but it is not the primary reason for continuous monitoring.

Selected Answer: B
B. confirm benefits are being realized.

choices.B: Include members of the help desk on the security incident response team.
choices.A: Provide the help desk with criteria for security incidents.
choices.C: Require the help desk to participate in past-incident reviews.
choices.D: Train the help desk to review the call logs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Out of the options provided, the one that would BEST enable the help desk to recognize an information security incident is:

A. Provide the help desk with criteria for security incidents.

By providing the help desk with clear criteria for identifying and recognizing security incidents, they will have a defined set of guidelines and indicators to follow when assessing incoming reports or incidents reported by users. This can help them quickly identify potential security incidents and take appropriate action. Having well-defined criteria ensures consistency in incident recognition and response, improving the overall effectiveness of the help desk in handling security incidents.

Selected Answer: A
A. Provide the help desk with criteria for security incidents.
